Bamidbar, בְּמִדְבַּר — 11/8/25

Torah: Numbers 1:20 - 1:46 (7)

Gospel: Luke 1:26-38 (13)

Passages

  • Torah: Numbers 1:20 - 1:46
  • Gospel: Luke 1:26-38

Torah — Numbers 1:20 - 1:46

LEB translation

1:20 The descendants of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, every male individually from twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:21 those who were counted from the tribe of Reuben were forty-six thousand five hundred.
1:22 From the descendants of Simeon, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, those who were counted according to the number of their names, every individual male from twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:23 those who were counted from the tribe of Simeon were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
1:24 From the descendants of Gad, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:25 those who were counted from the tribe of Gad were forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
1:26 From the descendants of Judah, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:27 those who were counted from the tribe of Judah were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
1:28 From the descendants of Issachar, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:29 those who were counted from the tribe of Issachar were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
1:30 From the descendants of Zebulun, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:31 those who were counted from the tribe of Zebulun were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
1:32 From the descendants of Joseph: from the descendants of Ephraim, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:33 those who were counted from the tribe of Ephraim were forty thousand five hundred.
1:34 From the descendants of Manasseh, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:35 those who were counted from the tribe of Manasseh were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
1:36 From the descendants of Benjamin, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:37 those who were counted from the tribe of Benjamin were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
1:38 From the descendants of Dan, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:39 those who were counted from the tribe of Dan were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
1:40 From the descendants of Asher, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:41 those who were counted from the tribe of Asher were forty-one thousand five hundred.
1:42 From the descendants of Naphtali, their genealogies according to their clans, according to their families, according to the number of names, from those twenty years old and above, everyone who is able to go to war:
1:43 those who were counted from the tribe of Naphtali were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
1:44 These are the ones counted whom Moses and Aaron mustered, with the twelve leaders of Israel, each one from his family.
1:45 So all those who were counted from the Israelites according to their families, from those twenty years old and above, everyone in Israel who is able to go to war.
1:46 All of the ones counted were six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty.

1:45
#15=Lבְּ/יִשְׂרָאֵֽל\׃be./Yis.ra.'Elin/IsraelbHR/Nplyis.ra.elb
     in/on/with Prefix beth: in, among, with, Israel A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.26; <br> son of: Isaac (H3327) and Rebekah (H7259); <br> brother of: Esau (H6215); married to Rachel (H7354), Leah (H3812), Zilpah (H2153) and Bilhah (H1090A); <br> father of: Reuben (H7205), Simeon (H8095), Levi (H3878), Judah (H3063), Dan (H1835H), Naphtali (H5321), Gad (H1410), Asher (H0836), Issachar (H3485), Zebulun (H2074), Dinah (H1783), Joseph (H3130) and Benjamin (H1144); also called Jacob frequently <BR> § Israel = "God prevails"<br>1) the second name for Jacob given to him by God after his wrestling with the angel at Peniel<br>2) the name of the descendants and the nation of the descendants of Jacob<br>2a) the name of the nation until the death of Solomon and the split<br>2b) the name used and given to the northern kingdom consisting of the 10 tribes under Jeroboam; the southern kingdom was known as Judah<br>2c) the name of the nation after the return from exile<br>in/on/with Prefix beth: in, among, with,
1:46
#11=Lוַ/חֲמִשִּֽׁים\׃va./cha.mi.Shimand/fiftyvHC/Acmpacha.mish.shimv
     and Conjunctive vav - i.e. followed by prefix, suffix or non-verb (conjunctive) (‘and/but’) fifty 1) fifty<br>1a) fifty (cardinal number)<br>1b) a multiple of fifty (with other numbers)<br>1c) fiftieth (ordinal number)and Conjunctive vav - i.e. followed by prefix, suffix or non-verb (conjunctive) (‘and/but’)

NIRV translation

1:20 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Reuben, Israel’s oldest son. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed one by one. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:21 The number from the tribe of Reuben was 46,500.
1:22 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Simeon. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed one by one. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:23 The number from the tribe of Simeon was 59,300.
1:24 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Gad. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:25 The number from the tribe of Gad was 45,650.
1:26 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Judah. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:27 The number from the tribe of Judah was 74,600.
1:28 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Issachar. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:29 The number from the tribe of Issachar was 54,400.
1:30 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Zebulun. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:31 The number from the tribe of Zebulun was 57,400.
1:32 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Ephraim, the son of Joseph. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:33 The number from the tribe of Ephraim was 40,500.
1:34 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Manasseh, the son of Joseph. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:35 The number from the tribe of Manasseh was 32,200.
1:36 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Benjamin. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:37 The number from the tribe of Benjamin was 35,400.
1:38 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Dan. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:39 The number from the tribe of Dan was 62,700.
1:40 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Asher. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:41 The number from the tribe of Asher was 41,500.
1:42 Here is the number of men from the tribe of Naphtali. All of the men who were able to serve in the army were counted. They were 20 years old or more. They were listed by name. They were listed in keeping with the records of their tribes and families.
1:43 The number from the tribe of Naphtali was 53,400.
1:44 Those were the men Moses and Aaron counted. The 12 leaders of Israel helped them. There was one leader from each tribe.
1:45 The men who were counted were able to serve in Israel’s army. All of them were 20 years old or more. They were counted family by family.
1:46 The total number was 603,550.

Gospel — Luke 1:26-38

LEB translation

1:26 Now in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee named Nazareth,
1:27 to a virgin legally promised in marriage to a man named Joseph of the house of David. And the name of the virgin was Mary.
1:28 And he came to her and said, “Greetings, favored one! The Lord is with you.”
1:29 But she was greatly perplexed at the statement, and was pondering what sort of greeting this might be.
1:30 “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
1:31 and you will call his name Jesus.
1:32 and the Lord God will give him the throne of his father David.
1:33 and of his kingdom there will be no end.
1:34 And Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I have not had sexual relations with a man?”
1:35 Verse text not available.
1:36 And behold, your relative Elizabeth—she also has conceived a son in her old age, and this is the sixth month for her who was called barren.
1:37 For nothing will be impossible with God.”
1:38 So Mary said, “Behold, the Lord’s female slave! May it happen to me according to your word.” And the angel departed from her.

NIRV translation

1:26 In the sixth month after Elizabeth had become pregnant, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee.
1:27 He was sent to a virgin. The girl was engaged to a man named Joseph. He came from the family line of David. The virgin’s name was Mary.
1:28 The angel greeted her and said, “The Lord has given you special favor. He is with you.”
1:29 Mary was very upset because of his words. She wondered what kind of greeting this could be.
1:30 But the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary. God is very pleased with you.
1:31 You will become pregnant and give birth to a son. You must name him Jesus.
1:32 He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High God. The Lord God will make him a king like his father David of long ago.
1:33 He will rule forever over his people, who came from Jacob’s family. His kingdom will never end.”
1:34 “How can this happen?” Mary asked the angel. “I am a virgin.”
1:35 The angel answered, “The Holy Spirit will come to you. The power of the Most High God will cover you. So the holy one that is born will be called the Son of God.
1:36 Your relative Elizabeth is old. And even she is going to have a child. People thought she could not have children. But she has been pregnant for six months now.
1:37 Nothing is impossible with God.”
1:38 “I serve the Lord,” Mary answered. “May it happen to me just as you said it would.” Then the angel left her.
